did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Preliminary Inventory of the Michael M. Byckoff Collection

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Currency, banknotes, and stamps, issued by the Russian Imperial and Soviet governments, and by various regional and local governments and banks during the period of the Russian Civil War.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: Russian and others

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Michael M. Byckoff Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Michael M. Byckoff collection consists of currency, banknotes, and postage stamp currency issued by the Russian Imperial and Soviet governments, and by various regional and local governments and banks during the period of the Russian Civil War.
The container list provided here lists the albums in each box of the collection.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Money--Russia.
Money--Soviet Union.
Postage-stamps--Russia.
Postage-stamps--Soviet Union.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: The items in this collection are being individually cataloged by Michael K. MacKenzie, Byckoff's grandson, using three currency catalogs: (1) Kardakov's catalog, in German and Russian, which has no illustrations of the currency; (2) Rybichenkov's catalog, in Russian, which is the most complete catalog but has very few illustrations of the currency; and (3) Pick's Standard Catalog of World Paper Money, in English, which is less complex than the other catalogs. The format used by MacKenzie for listing each item and its catalog numbers from the three catalogs is explained in the key accompanying the item-level description.

At present MacKenzie's item-level description is available for one album, labeled "Crimea" (box 8). As additional albums are cataloged by MacKenzie, the descriptions will be added to the detailed finding aid for this collection, which is available at the Hoover Institution Archives reading room.

did.unittitle: Printed Matter
Paper Money of Russia and the USSR, by Albert I. Malyshev, Vladimir I. Tarankov, and Igor N. Smirenny, published 1991
The Complete Catalog of Paper Banknotes and Bills of Russia, the USSR and CIS Countries, 1769-1994, by Peter F. Ryabchenko, published 1995
Albums
Photograph album. Miscellaneous bonds
"Private." Miscellaneous notes, postage currency, and bonds
"Private." Various ribbons, notes, bonds
Album of local issue notes

"Bukhara." Includes notes of the Emirate of Bukhara [Khanate of Bukhara], the Soviet People's Republic of Bukhara [Bukharskaia Narodnaia Sovetskaia Respublica], Khiva, Khan, and the Khorezm People's Soviet Republic
"Central Asia." Notes of the Turkestan region, the Transcaspian regional government, the British Military Mission in the Transcaspian region, Semirech'e, and miscellaneous notes, stamps, and bonds
"Central." Includes notes and bonds of the Northern Region, Northwest Front, Archangel'sk government territory, as well as other miscellaneous notes

"Crimea." Includes notes of the Crimea territorial government; Don Cossack government; South Russia, High Command of the Armed Forces; British State Treasury; and Plenipotentiary for Food of the Government Territory of Kherson, as well as other miscellaneous notes.

note.p: A detailed description, with catalog numbers, is available.

did.unittitle: "Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania." Includes Arnsenburg notes and notes of Lithuania and Memel Notgeld
"Imperial." Various notes of the Czarist empire
"N. Caucasus"
"Siberia #1." Notes and bonds
"Siberia #2." Notes of the Blagoveshchensk, Khabarovsk, and Irkutsk regions, as well as various cities and local regions
"Siberia #3." Includes Shanghai Russian and Japanese occupation of Manchuria notes

"Transcaucasian." Notes and bonds from Transcaucasian Socialist Federal Soviet Republic [Zakavkazskaia Sotsialisticheskaia Federativnaia Sovetskaia Respublica], Transcaucasian, Armenia-Autonomous Republic, and various other regions and territories
Map of the Chinese Eastern Railroad
"Ukraine #1." Notes of the Liep'ja region in Latvia and other regions and cities, the State Bank in Kiev, the Ukrainian Soviet Republic, and the German occupation in World War II
"Ukraine #2." Local issue notes
"U.S.S.R." Notes, postage stamp currency, and bonds
